caption.p: Synopsis of medicinal plants used in the management of malaria in Kenya.

tr.td: Launaea cornuta (Oliv and Hiern) C. Jeffrey
Vernonia brachycalyx O. Hoffm. Lasiopa Lam.
Diospyros abyssinica (Hiern) F. White subsp. abyssinica
Abrus precatorius L. ssp africanus Verdc
Ocimum gratissimum L. Suave wiild, O. tomentosum Oliv.
Rotheca myricoides (Hochst.) Steane and Mabb ( Clerodendrum myricoides (Hochst.) Vatke)
Ficus bussei Warb ex Mildbr and Burret
Rumex steudelii Hochst ex A. Rich
Agathisanthenum globosum (Hochst. ex A. Rich.) Bremek.
Vangueria madagascariensis Gmel ( Vangueria acutiloba Robyns)
Clausena anisata (Willd) Hook. f. ex Benth.
Roots, root bark, leaves, fruits (multiple parts)
Decoction; prepared with salt and milk

fn.p: Language is also known as Kikamba. Local names with language(s) not indicated are sometimes a blend of Kiswahili and other local languages or were not specified by the authors. Decoction involves boiling a plant part in water. Infusion entails soaking of a plant part in water.
